title: Air traffic controller Philip Maschek arrested for public intoxication
text:
45 shares 2
View
comments
An air traffic controller is facing criminal charges after he was allegedly found to be intoxicated and half naked on the job.
A worker found Philip Maschek, 50, unconscious after a pilot who wanted to take off didn’t get a response from the tower at Springdale Municipal Airport in north-west Arkansas, said officials.
Mr Maschek, who was ‘passed out in his chair with his shirt off’, was arrested for public intoxication, according to a police report.
Police were alerted after a pilot failed to get a response from the air traffic control tower (file photo)
He was in charge of air traffic for about two hours before he was discovered last Thursday at 7:45am, the Democrat Gazette reported.

Philip Maschek has been charged with public intoxication following his arrest at the airport
Police said Mr Maschek, who was wearing a black robe and house shoes, failed field sobriety tests and was slurring his speech and swaying on his feet.
He wasn’t immediately handcuffed as police feared he was too intoxicated to climb down a steep ladder, the police report stated.
He denied being intoxicated and took issue with the word ‘public’ when told he was being arrested for public intoxication, the Democrat Gazette reported.
Wyman Morgan, an administrative and financial services director for the City of Springdale, said such a mistake ‘would not be tolerated’.
He told the newspaper: ‘The tower operator has control and responsibility of the safety of the planes landing and taking off at the airport.
'It's a very safety-oriented position.’
The police report did not state a blood-alcohol content reading.
Mr Maschek refused to submit to a breath test and police didn’t take a breath sample, an officer wrote in the report.
In addition to police, the Federal Aviation Administration and Mr Maschek’s employer, Robinson Aviation, said they are both investigating the incident.
